variant.question:

What is true about a clearway?

options.text: A clearway can be water or land and must be under the control of the aerodrome authority.
A clearway must have an imaginary gradient of 1.5 %
A clearway has a minimum width of 90 m.
A clearway can be used to bring the aircraft to a full stop after an engine failure.

variant.question: What happens to Specific Range (SR) for a heavier aircraft?

options.text: SR improves above Maximum Zero Fuel Mass.

Regarding clearways, which of the following statements is correct?

options.text: A clearway is an area of land or water beyond the runway that must be under the control of the airport authority.
The minimum clearway width is 90 m either side of the extended centreline.
